roleset.name: generally very positive, pleasing, better than 'good'
roleset.note: GREAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, good.01. (from great.01-j)

role.descr: generally positive/pleasing entity (concation may be required)

example.name: both args
example.text: His sister wasn't great to me either, in the beginning.

example.name: concatenation
example.text: It's great of you to come over, Lisa.

example.name: Tour de France
example.text: I think the first stage is great this year with no prologue so any one of the rider's could be in yellow after the first day rather than one of a few .

roleset.name: very skilled at
roleset.note: GREAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, good.02. (from great.02-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: The Pentagon Is Great at Blowing Your Money

roleset.name: large, physically or metaphorically
roleset.note: GREAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1. (from great.03-j)
GREATER-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from greater.03-j)

example.name: almighty, not just just fabulous
example.text: God is great, sing His praise

example.name: Significant/large, not wonderful
example.text: Two! Four! Six! Eight! Homer's Crime Was Very Great!

example.name: Large in scope, widespread: sweating sickness
example.text: In London the mortality was very great; the court was broken up, and Henry VIII left London, frequently changing his residence.

roleset.name: beneficial, possibly for health
roleset.note: GREAT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, good.04. (from great.04-j)

example.name: both args
example.text: Sorry about my cuts, acetone isn't great for the healing process

example.name: both args, non-health
example.text: Google Glass Is Great for Toddlers. Seriously.

roleset.name: the greater than symbol '>'. mathematical equation., greater than
roleset.note: GREATER_THAN_SYMBOL-J NOTES: .This sense is reserved for instances of mathematical greater-than-ness. It will mostly likely occur as the '> ' symbol. It *might* be spelled out at some point, but please do not use this sense for the standard comparative form of 'great'. General bigger or better-than-ness, outside of the domain of mathematics, is not what this sense is aimed at. Added by Julia. (from great.05-j)
>-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. (from >.01-j)

role.descr: left side of the mathematical equation
right side of the mathematical equation

example.name: both args
example.text: mod drusen and RPE changes OU , egg yolk lesion OD> OS edema , exudates , or hemorrhage , OU
